info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 17 at 5:48PM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN ALLEN... SOUTHEASTERN WHITLEY...NORTHEASTERN HUNTINGTON AND NORTH CENTRAL WELLS COUNTIES THROUGH 630 PM EDT... At 547 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near South Whitley, or 7 miles south of Columbia City, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Southern portions of Fort Wayne, Aboite, Roanoke, Zanesville, Laud, Nine Mile, Goblesville, Tunker, Washington Center, Mahon, Rolling Hills, Luther, and Peabody. This includes the following highways... Interstate 469 between mile markers 0 and 5, and between mile markers 7 and 8. Interstate 69 in Indiana between mile markers 289 and 301. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
